body:
I do not have access to an account that can access the AWS Billing and Cost Management console. I am able to authenticate via email for the root account, but the person who had the MFA device has left the company, so I cannot access the phone number associated with the device.

Hello.
Have you tried disabling MFA using the steps in the following document?
https://repost.aws/knowledge-center/reset-root-user-mfa
If you are unable to disable MFA using the steps in the above document, you will need to contact AWS via the URL below.
https://support.aws.amazon.com/#/contacts/one-support?formId=mfa

Apart from Riku's suggestion, you could also try this assuming your AWS account is not the top-level account of the organisation
You can now setup centralised access to member accounts from the top-level account as described in this documentation -
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_root-enable-root-access.html
. That way, you can have root level access from the top-level account instead of configuring root access for each accounts.
